alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo; Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 05 at 4:55AM PST until January 05 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, South-Central San Luis Obispo County and Northwest Santa Barbara County. * WHEN...Until 730 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Potential debris flows including rock and mud slides. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated a slow-moving band of heavy rain over the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Maria, Nipomo and Orcutt. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
